page.title: 03EDGAR FARM - EGMERE AREA
page.content: This is an{arable}farm. It is part of the Walsingham Estate and{650 acres}in size. The smallest field is 6 acres and the largest 77 acres. The land is light and stony.{Crops}grown are barley, sugar beet, wheat, parsnips and white turnip. The fields are divided by hedges which give wildlife good cover. It also has some wooded areas. One of these contains the{ruins {of an airforce hospital}used in the 1939-45 war. The disused airfield is nearby. The grain stores and workshops are former R.A.F. buildings. These are at Bunker's Hill.{Four men}work the land, one of whom also tends the modern machinery. There are four tractors, two combine harvesters and various other implements. The centre of the farm is the farmhouse itself. Six tied cottages go with the farm. Sixty pigs are kept.
